Dulce de Leche Stuffed Chocolate Chunk Cookies: These cookies are a creation of my attempt to use up the multiple jars of dulce de leche my brother graciously brought back for me from his trip to Argentina.  He had some time off while switching jobs.  He is now is at his new fancy hedge fund job and I‚Äôm such a proud older sis! It was also conveniently his birthday, so most of these cookies went to him since he is a CCC fiend. .
These are a modified recipe of mine, which will be up on fullstackkithen.com soon! They have a mix of milk and dark chocolate @gittard discs, flakey salt on top and a healthy dollop of dulce inside, which spreads along with the cookie to create a thin layer of dulce throughout ü§üüèª
.
.
.

Strawberry Rhubarb Crumb Bars: These are so good that I made them twice in a week! They are mostly filled with strawberries and rhubarb with a some blueberries and raspberries thrown in at the end!  I tried once with fresh and another batch w/mostly frozen fruit and both are üíØ. I first made and brought these to my friend‚Äôs house up north for MDW and they were definitely a hit and helped balance out the slightly aggressive amount of carbs and beer that was consumed. It was a holiday right?
.
.
Recipe can be found at: http://www.fullstackkitchen.com/berry-rhubarb-bars/ - or link in my bio! Im doing a *very* soft launch of my blog, still got to work out some kinks, add some filtering/tagging functionality and fix some DNS issues but its mostly there! üéâ I pretty much coded the site from scratch using React/Gatsby/GraphQL/Github Pages and I am pretty proud of it üôÉ Please comment or DM me if you have any feedback for me, I‚Äôd love it all!

Apple Blush Pie ü•ß : Happy Spring! I made this last week for Pi Day, because one pie just wasn‚Äôt enough! Though that does mean I‚Äôve had pie every day this week, but not the worst thing in the world. This pie gets its red/blush tone from beets and blood oranges! I wanted to use up the last bits of winter/fall fruits before Spring starts (so before today :P) The blood orange juice makes this a much different apple pie than I‚Äôve ever tasted!
..

Harvest Bridal Shower Cake üçÅüéÇ: This is a vanilla champagne cake, filled with homemade raspberry rose jam and lemon curd, wrapped in St Germain Swiss meringue buttercream, decorated with fresh flowers.. This was commissioned by a friend for a bridal shower, who wanted Fall vibes but with some more unique flavor combos. 
.
This cake really was a labor of love. I messed up the butter ratio for the cake and put in DOUBLE the amount of butter ( was using a diff type than normal ), sometimes I do mess up!. It tasted damn delicious but completely fell apart when cooling.  Those turned into cake pops, doubling the amount of work I did, but they were super tasty.  You could say I baked all Friday. The flowers were dropped off Saturday morning, right before the shower and I finished decorating and flower arranging within 30 minutes lol. And then walked it over to @sundayinbrooklyn . It was lots of fun, and I was super happy with the results! 
. 
Cake recipe is from @testkitchen ‚Äòs Perfect Cake cookbook, jam recipe is from @bonappetitmag , and lemon curd and Swiss meringue buttercream recipes are from @sallysbakeblog 
.

Orange White Chocolate UVA Macarons üèÄüç´üçä: The NCAA basketball championship game was last night and the University of Virginia men‚Äôs team, @uvamenshoops, came out on top!! My lil brother went to UVA and was at the final four games in Minneapolis, so I was *kinda* obligated to cheer for them, but damn did they have some close and exciting last few games ü§üüèª‚õπüèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Sports games weren‚Äôt really a thing people went to at my alma mater (and when we did have games I was most likely across the street in the engineering lab lol), so it was exciting to cheer for a team that actually is now National Champs! Basketball has always been a big part of my life. My brother and I both played in HS (both pretty tall, but he‚Äôs much better than me), heavily influenced by our dad who still plays and wrecks multiple times a week in his mellow yellow league - So making these were super fun! #wahoowa #gohoos @uva @virginiasports
.
The base macaron recipe from @cloudykitchen & @foxandcrane , adding in 1/2 tsp of orange and 1/2 tsp of vanilla extract.  Filling is a whipped white chocolate ganache, tinted with butterfly pea flowers. @wiltoncakes stars and decorating pen. .
To make ganache, bring 300g of heavy cream to a boil and add a handful of butterfly pea flowers steep for about 10 min. Pour over 16oz of white chocolate, chopped + 2 Tbsp of butter.  Let sit for 3 min then stir until smooth.  Chill in the fridge for 1-2 hours.  Put ganache + 4 Tbsp of butter in bowl of stand mixer with whisk attachment. Whip for at least 5 minutes until light and fluffy.  Add food coloring if you want.
.
.

Carrot Coconut Cake w/ Honey Cream Cheese Frosting: I made this cake a few weeks ago for one of my closest friends and overall awesome person @iamdopico ‚Äôs birthday.  She always tells me she doesn‚Äôt eat sweets (its a shock we‚Äôre still friends) except for my baked goods. I guess I should be flattered üòè So therefore for her birthday I decided on a carrot cake, cutting the sugar a bit and used a cream cheese frosting that is solely sweetened with honey. The sunflowers were fun to make and I tried to go for those Van Gough vibes.
.
Carrot cake is a combo of @testkitchen and @livforcake ‚Äôs recipes for carrot cake (with some added coconut ü••ü§üüèª) Honey cream cheese frosting is from America‚Äôs test kitchen as well. The flowers are made with plain ol‚Äô american buttercream in order to keep their shape.
.
.

Dirty Chai Almond Brownies (GF) -  Its currently Passover, and I usually try to keep kosher for passover. That means no wheat, grains or legumes.  A bakers nightmare. My family and I were in Vermont this past weekend and did a small seder in an RV kitchen, which was a sight to be seen üòÇ It was lovely, we skied and hiked! I bought some chai infused honey while there, which inspired these brownies.  I altered a GF Brownie recipe i found on @kingarthurflour , reducing the sugar almost by half since I probably was gonna eat most of these myself, adding some honey, chai spices, espresso and chopped unsweetened @callebautchocolate chocolate (regular chocolate usually has soy lecithin, which isn‚Äôt K for P - according to some). Altered Recipe below! - 5 tbsp butter, melted
- 2/3 cup sugar
- 6 tbsp honey
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1 tsp¬†vanilla
- 1¬†tsp¬†ginger, 1/2¬†tsp¬†cinnamon, 1/2 tsp cardamon, 1/4 tsp allspice, 1/4 tsp cloves
- 1/2 tsp instant espresso, dissolved in 2 tsp hot water
- 3/4 cup¬†cocoa powder
- 3 large eggs
- 1 1/2 cups¬†almond flour
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 4oz unsweetened chocolate, chopped
- Maldon salt for finishing

Preheat oven to 350.  Mix butter, sugars, salt, vanilla, spices, espresso, cocoa and eggs in a bowl until smooth. Then mix in almond flour and baking powder.  Add in chocolate till just mixed.  Put into a parchment paper lined 8x8 pan.  Bake for 35 min until set. Cool for 15.

Chocolate Babka w/ chocolate streusel: One of my favorite desserts. It‚Äôs a yeasted sweet dough, spread with a rich chocolate filling and rolled and cut to create those beautiful swirls. AND then topped with a buttery chocolate streusel 
.
.
I can‚Äôt believe I made this babka almost 3 months ago. Work, life, biking, etc have all contributed to letting things like baking (with any consistency) fall through the cracks, but there‚Äôs something to be said about balance. Like today, I‚Äôm spending it at the park, reading ‚Äòthe defining decade‚Äô (sorta having a crisis that I‚Äôm almost done w/ my 20s), and will treat myself to a slice of this (frozen) babka later 
.
.
PSA: Babka freezes exceptionally well (just nuke it for 10 sec), and still tastes great months later. I froze one of the loaves I made and it‚Äôs been a real treat whenever I remember it‚Äôs still there and treat myself!
.
Recipe for chocolate babka came from @nytcooking & @clarkbar - it was one of the best recipes I‚Äôve made so far for babka - the fluffiest and most chocolatey. See the making of it in my babka highlight. 
.
.

Strawberry Rose Italian Rainbow Cookies: A little #TBT to these rainbow cookies I made last year / some valentines day content for y‚Äôall. These sweet marzipan almond cookies are sandwiched with homemade strawberry rhubarb jam, covered in dark chocolate and garnished with Ruby chocolate and sprinkles. What more can you ask for in one cookie?  I really wish I had some of these right now...
.
For the cookies I slightly modified @mollyyeh ‚Äôs ‚Äúmatcha, red bean and almond rainbow cookies recipe‚Äù, replacing the lemon juice with 2 tsp of rose water and added varying levels of ground up freeze dried strawberries (used a coffee grinder) and red food coloring to produce that ombre effect .  Then i tempered chocolate and poured it over the loaf. .
.

Rhubarb almond picnic bars: Happy Monday! I can‚Äôt believe that Memorial Day (and the unofficial start of summer) is in a week! Rhubarb season is in full force and I‚Äôd highly recommend making these v portable treats to bring to your MDW/outdoor festivities. I love love love the taste and look of rhubarb! Recipe is from @smittenkitchen , just search ‚Äúalmond rhubarb picnic bars‚Äù
.
Sweet and tart at the same time, with a perfect little crust. I had to unexpectedly go back to FL last week and my dad (who‚Äôs not much of a sweets guy) was a huge fan of these. + They held up pretty well in transportation
.
.
Cutting the diagonal pieces are not as hard as you‚Äôd think, cut one piece at an angle and then place it on top and use it as a ruler/stencil for cutting the rest! Also remember to cut half of the pieces in the opposite direction in order to get this chevron pattern. Else you‚Äôll have to flip half of them. 
.

Rhubarb Blueberry Frangipane Tart w/ Strawberry Rhubarb Jam: On my way home from a bike ride this past weekend I stopped by the Union Square farmers market and was stoked to find some fresh rhubarb.  They fit perfectly in my jersey‚Äôs back jersey pocket!  Plus, a Rhubarb frangipane tart is a perfect way to showcase the beautiful colors of fruit and is somewhat patriotic for this 4th of July weekend! 
.
This tart has a flakey shortbread crust, a sweet rich almond frangipane (frangipane is basically made up of flour + almonds + eggs + sugar + butter), strips of bright red and green rhubarb, and brushed with homemade jam! 
.
Recipe for this tart is from @theflouredtable (search rhubarb frangipane tart) 
.

Fig Oat Chocolate Chip Bars: So tbh I made these over a year ago and just never got around to sharing photos of them.  So just popping in and saying hi (I know its been a while üò¨) now that we are in the height of Fig season.

Just a reminder that the election is tomorrow in case you‚Äôve been living under a rock. I thought I‚Äôd close off an endless election season by reminding myself about one of the most fundamental rights we have as Americans, in tart form. It is your right to exercise your vote and have your vote counted, no matter how its done. I voted through mail and submitted my ballot a few weeks ago to ensure it received on time, which the BOE says it was ü•≥. GO VOTE!
.
This is a Kiwi Berry and Blueberry Vanilla Almond Tart. Kiwi berries, otherwise known as hardy kiwis, are a miniature version of kiwifruit.  They are sweeter, have edible skins (so no peeling!), and are absolutely adorably sized (like a grape). Right now they are available at the TJs near me in NYC.  I first saw these berries at a farmers market on UPenn‚Äôs campus like 8 years ago and freaked out how good they were and then never saw them again until last year around this time at Trader Joes. You cant imagine how happy I was. I‚Äôd highly recommend looking out for these cuties. Recipe for the tart is from @bonappetit & @moroccochris 
.
. Also shout out to Group Nine / @thrillist for giving us the day off of work to go vote ..

Berry & Flowers Battenberg Cake üå∏: Its really starting to feel like spring in NYC! (Well, except for the fact it‚Äôs in the 40s today..) The cherry blossoms all over the city are showing off, and I was inspired by them to make something to celebrate spring! Battenberg cakes have been featured a few times on Great British Bake Off and I‚Äôve been dying to try making one!
.
I used @thaliaho ‚Äòs recipe for a Citrus rose Battenberg cake, but changed it up a bit. The two cake are blueberry lavender and raspberry rose, glued together with a homemade blueberry lavender jam and wrapped in homemade rose marzipan. Some of my favorite flavor combos! It turned out fantastic (if Id say so myself) and the flowers weren‚Äôt too overpowering)! I used rose water and lavender extract from @lavenderbythebay . Then I used freeze dried berries from Trader Joe‚Äôs for the fruit flavors.

Rhubarb Almond Frangipane Tart w/ Cherry Rhubarb Jam: I know rhubarb season is almost over, but I just needed to buy some when I saw a full table of it at the farmers market a little while back. This tart has a flakey shortbread crust, a sweet rich almond frangipane (frangipane is  basically made up of flour + almonds + eggs + sugar + butter), strips of bright red and green rhubarb, and brushed with homemade cherry rhubarb jam! Rhubarb is one of those ingredients that always gets me so excited whenever I see it at the markets, and I‚Äôm always sad when the season is over.  So make the most of summer! .
Recipe for this tart is from @theflouredtable (search rhubarb frangipane tart) - I had to use up some cherries so I made the jam (basically 2/3 cherries, 1/3 rhubarb + sugar + lemon cooked down) that I brushed on top. Turned out great and I have more jam for a different project!

Fig and Cherry Plum Galette: I cant believe it‚Äôs only just Tuesday üòí I spent most of the day trying to remember how Java works (the programming language) since I‚Äôve been mostly writing in JavaScript (and Python) the past few years at my job. It was a real struggle trying to remember how types work and it gave me not so great flashbacks to my college Computer Science classes. At least I have some of this galette left at home to try and block any further trips down memory of all the all-nighters I had to pull. This galette is not too sweet, super easy to make and is perfect for any time of day ü§ôüèº
.
To make it, slice figs and @traderjoes cherry plums and toss with ¬Ω tsp vanilla, 1 tsp lemon juice, 3 tbsp sugar, 1 tsp cornstarch and let sit for 10 min. I pulled out some pie dough from the freezer, recipe from @birdsblack - rolled out to a circle 1/8th of an inch. Arrange fruit on dough and fold in the dough on all sides. Refrigerate for 30 min.  Brush sides with egg wash and sprinkle sparkling sugar. bake at 375 for 35-40 or until golden. .
.

Buckeye Balls ‚ú®: I recently joined a group of friends who were doing a monthly bookclub and it was finally my turn to host last week! I chose the book ‚ÄòLittle Fires Everywhere‚Äô by @pronounced_ing which I tremendously enjoyed.  It was overall an easy and enjoyable read with a bunch of interesting themes for us to talk about üíÅüèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è I think its gonna make a great TV adaptation, coming to @hulu soon. Well the story takes place in Shaker Heights Ohio, and these sugary indulgent balls are a true Ohio staple. I glitzed them up with some sprinkles and @wiltoncakes gold spray ! I served alongside a ton of cheese, crackers and beet goat cheese hummus ü§ôüèº
.
 If you‚Äôve read Little Fires Everywhere what did you think of it?!
.
Buckeye Balls - makes ~ 30
1 container (1.5 cups) of peanut butter
4 cups of powdered sugar
1 1/2 tsp vanilla extract
1 tsp cinnamon
1/2 cup of butter
8 oz dark chocolate
1 Tbsp shortening or coconut oil
Sprinkles
.
Combine first 5 ingredients in a bowl. Using a 2 tsp cookie scoop, create balls and place on a sheet pan lined with wax/parchment paper. Refrigerate for 30 min. Using a double broiler or microwave, melt chocolate and shortening until smooth.  Using a toothpick, dip each ball into the chocolate and return to pan. Add sprinkles. Refrigerate another 30 min and enjoy!
.

Hibiscus Macarons w/ Mango Curd & Lemon Lime Buttercream - are these macarons a little Barney themed? - maybe.. Do they taste like a tropical island dream (and are kosher for passover) - absolutely!
.
I‚Äôve been restraining from baking too much these days since I can‚Äôt distribute my sweets my normal ways (ie. my office, friend‚Äôs apartments), but wanted to make macarons while its still Passover because they‚Äôre gluten free! @traderjoes ‚Äò powdered sugar uses tapioca instead of cornstarch, which makes it K for P! Corn is a nogo üò¨ On a zoom call w/friends recently I was pulling out random ingredients I had in my pantry and realized that the random dried hibiscus flowers I had would probably taste great in macarons! Paired with some bright flavors, it really melds into a super tasty treat!
.
I tried a different macaron recipe than my normal one, taking the base of @piesandtacos macaron recipe and replacing 10g of the powdered sugar with ground hibiscus. Her method requires heating the egg whites and sugar in a saucepan till they‚Äôre dissolved and then transferring to the stand mixer to whip. I normally just whip from cold. Macarons are so finicky so I‚Äôm not sure whether it was this process, the actual recipe, or my mixing, but these turned out pretty different than previous attempts.  They were not hollow (hallelujah!) but we‚Äôre flatter and chewier than normal. I will continue experimenting! Next time I may try the Italian meringue method ü§üüèª
.
Mango lime curd recipe is from @bonappetitmag archives (w/ some passionfruit sugar i had), and the buttercream is a basic buttercream with lime juice, zest and lemon curd

Apple Galette w/ Vermont Maple Syrup üçé ü•ê: My mom and I are currently on our third and last day of a ‚ÄúLaminating Pastry Intensive Workshop‚Äù at @kingarthurflour ‚Äòs baking school in Norwich, VT. I‚Äôve done a few classes here before, but I‚Äôm constantly impressed every time. Their cafe, school and shop (which is a great exercise in practicing self control) are all awesome. I‚Äôve been posting snippets from the class on my stories and they will be in the highlights ü§ôüèº
.
The first day we learned how to make a blitz (rough) puff and prepped all the dough for various pastries. A blitz puff uses flattened cubes of butter folded in instead of a sheet of butter, then a few folds all at once to mimic a puff pastry. This Apple galette uses said blitz pastry and was brushed with maple syrup üçÅ right out of the oven ü§§ Second photo were turnovers using the blitz that we stuffed with tomato sauce, caramelized onions and spinach.

Brown Butter Blondies w/ a Dark Chocolate Swirl:  These blondies have un-bashfully been my breakfast for the past few days.  They‚Äôre decadent enough to curb my morning sweet tooth but somehow still feel.  I made these for Valentines Day when I wanted something easy but impressive looking! ü•∞
.
I bought @sarah_kieffer ‚Äòs new-ish book, 100 Cookies a little while ago and have been very eager to try out some of its recipes. I got the Vanilla Bean Baking Book a few years ago and absolutely loved every recipe I made from there. 100 Cookies has such a great variety of pan banging cookies, brownies and bars!
.
As my first recipe from the book, I actually ended up combining two recipes, the Brown Butter Blondies, and the Swirl Brownies. 
Basically made the blondies as written, but then swirled in a mix of dark chocolate and sweetened condensed milk to create those lovely swirls of richness. They are not oily at all, which I‚Äôve experienced with other blondie recipes and truly are so delicious! And not too sugary either! Im excited to try more recipes from this book very soon! Sarah really is the cookie queen!
.
I went a bit overboard w/using my good chocolate (it was Vday!) and mixed @guittardchocolate w/ @dandelionchocolate ‚Äôs chefs chocolate for the swirl and used @callebautchocolate chunks in the batter. Ugh so good!
.

Stuffed Speculaas Cookies: The dough is jam packed with warming spices, such as cardamom, cinnamon and coriander, and the middle is a soft marzipan like filling, with a hint of citrus. Its baked in a log, similar to biscotti, but is much softer and cut after its out of the oven. This is perfect dipped in a cup of coffee (or espresso!). These gevulde (stuffed) speculaas cookies come from the Sweet Cookbook by @ottolenghi and @helen_goh_bakes. These sort of cookies are very commonly made in Danish households during the holidays.  I LOVE marzipan and these did not disappoint. 
.
I started making these Friday morning for a Holiday party this weekend, excited to bake for friends, but it quickly got cancelled because of the surge of Covid cases in NYC. I still went ahead with making these, as a lil pick-me-up, and instead spent the rest of the weekend eating these and playing with the cats. Not the worst way to spend a weekend‚Ä¶ Stay safe everyone! 
.
I‚Äôve made quite a few things from the Sweet book, and they‚Äôve all been fantastic.  A little labor intensive, but the flavors really shine through!

Pecan Brittle Bark Cookies:  Holiday baking is in full effect in my apartment, and these babies are making an appearance.  The recipe is a little involved - you make hard pecan caramel that gets broken up and made into a dark chocolate caramel bark.  The bark is then used instead of chocolate chips in the cookie recipe.  It so good, the flavors are so much more elevated than a typical CCC, and the brown sugar/oil ratios give it a really soft but perfect texture when you bite into it. Recipe is from #thecookiebook by @displacedhousewife ! .

Raspberry Rose Pistachio Cardamon Rugelach: I made these ruggies for Hanukah last month and never posted them, so here they are! The holidays may be over but cookies will never go out of season.  This seems to be a pattern. I make something, edit photos and then never know what to say/the right timing to post.  And then weeks go by and then it‚Äôs ‚Äútoo late‚Äù. Well one of my resolutions for 2021 is to try to push through some of that and say fuck it. Try to be proactive but if I don‚Äôt post right away, not beat myself up about it. So please enjoy something non-coup related in your feed tonight. Baking is a great way to practice self love when the world is on fire.
..
Now back to these rugelach cookies ‚Äî 
I used the base cookie from @clarkbar ‚Äôs Cherry Rugelach w/ cardamom sugar that‚Äôs on @nytcooking . I made rose sugar, which you combine 1/2 cup sugar + 2tsp rose water and let it sit for a few hours.  I used half of it to top the cookies and  I used half for the filling.  For the filling I combined 1/4c rose sugar, 1/2c sugar, 2tsp cardamom, 3/4c chopped pistachios.  Then after they are rolled out I spread a layer of raspberry @bonnemaman_us jam, and then spread some of the filling on top.  Cut and rolled (last slide for an example)
